title.narrative: South Sudan Joint Response III

description.narrative: The South Sudan Joint Response 3 prioritizes to save lives and alleviate suffering of those most in need of assistance and protection, and protect the rights and uphold the dignity of the most vulnerable.
World Vision targets 30,000 individuals through the WASH and Protection interventions.

World Vision's programme contributes to the following objectives: Protection.R2 Individuals are supported to achieve solutions and freedom of movement, and the coping strategies and protection capacities of communities and local actors are strengthened WASH.R1 Re-establish and improve access to water, sanitation and hygiene promotion services to the vulnerable population affected by conflict, disease outbreaks, acute malnutrition and floods WASH.R2 Enhance emergency WASH capacities of lcoal communities, authorities and partners

title.narrative: FSL.R2 Protect and promote livelihoods to enhance coping mechanisms and improve access to food
# of beneficiaries receiving start-up agricultural and/or aquacultural inputs (seeds, tools, fishing equipment)

description.narrative: Activities: Supporting HHs with staple seeds and tools for the 2017 season through seed distribution.

comment.narrative: A few changes were made to the FSL activities based on what is feasible in the context. Also, many households throughout NBeG are at the brink of famine and food is not available in the market, so food production assistance has become a lifesaving intervention. So, WV increased its support to food production assistance activities mainly focusing on fishing kits that increase access to fish protein, short duration vegetables and early maturing crop varieties to produce quick wins for food availability. Secondly, the project location has also been changed from Aweil North to Aweil East and South. The aweil east payams include angartong, baac, madhol and malualbaai. The aweil south payams include nyocawany,wathmuok, and panthouand Tieraliet)

title.narrative: N.R1 Increase community based management of acute malnutrition for the most vulnerable and at risk
# of cooking demonstrations conducted

description.narrative: Conduct cooking demonstration

comment.narrative: Because the situation explained above, World Vision selected these nutrition sensitive activities that can they can have a lifesaving impact by increasing awareness in the community, enhancing community empowerment and participation , strengthening the referral systems and increasing service provision uptake which will lead to more positive maternal and child health outcome. The nutrition sensitive activities were not implemented in this reporting period, but it will be completed before the end of this project.
